name: Pancake Poppers
author: ELLOWYN
summary: Pancakes didn't turn out so well on my electric stove top, so I invented these. They are light and airy and freeze well too. Try them with strawberry jam, dipped in syrup, or sprinkled with powdered sugar. Perfect for kid and adult brunches! This is a wonderful pancake recipe on its own too.
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Spray 2 mini muffin tins with cooking spray
Mix milk and vinegar together in a bowl; let stand until milk curdles, about 5 minutes
Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a bowl; stir into milk mixture until smooth
Spoon batter into the prepared muffin tins with a tablespoon or a small batter scoop
Bake in the preheated oven until batter is risen and still pale, about 8 minutes
Remove from muffin cups with a silicone scraper
